DataElement.preferredName: Person Surgical Procedure Injury Eligibility Determination Ind-3b
DataElement.preferredDefinition: an indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or not applicable related to the act of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study by having had a diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue or damage inflicted on the body as the direct or indirect result of an external force, with or without disruption of structural continuity.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Surgical Procedure Injury Eligibility Determination
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the act of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study by having had a diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue or damage inflicted on the body as the direct or indirect result of an external force, with or without disruption of structural continuity.

Property.preferredDefinition: Used for operative procedures on organs, regions, or tissues in the treatment of diseases, including tissue section by lasers. It excludes transplantation, for which "transplantation" is used.:Damage inflicted on the body as the direct or indirect result of an external force, with or without disruption of structural continuity.:Criteria to determine eligibility of patients for medical care programs and services.

Concepts.definition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.
Damage inflicted on the body as the direct or indirect result of an external force, with or without disruption of structural continuity.
The act of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/not applicable.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or not applicable.

Concepts.longName: Yes, No, or Not Applicable Response
Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or not applicable.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.2.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Retired DBW 04-27-2016 per Tina Taylor approved by Dianne Reves

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. 8/3/2015 Corrections made to VD in order to restore to original format: removed C49486 as rep term and replaced with C49797; restored long name and definition per Dianne Reeves/tt.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Has the patient had a major s
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had a major surgical procedure, open biopsy or significant traumatic injury within 28 days of treatment start date of Bevacizumab therapy (cycle 2)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is a major surgical procedure anticipated during the course of the study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: GOG_CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had a major surgical procedure, open biopsy, dental extractions or other dental surgery/procedure that results in an open wound, or significant traumatic injury within 28 days prior to the first date of treatment on this study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Prior minor surgical procedure, stereotactic biopsy, fine needle aspiration, or core biopsy

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had a major surgical procedure, open biopsy, or significant traumatic injury within 28 days prior to randomization?

ReferenceDocuments.name: PBTC_Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient undergone an intermediate surgical procedure as defined in the protocol less than or equal to 2 weeks prior to treatment?
